This Privacy Policy describes how DomainsBot collects, stores,
uses, and safeguards your information when you use our Services.

By using our Services, you understand and acknowledge that collection and use

Information We Collect About You and How We Collect It

DomainsBot collects personal information when you interact with our Services.

The types of personal information that we may collect about you include, but
are not limited to: information you provide to us, information from third
parties, and information collected automatically about your use of our Sites
and Services.

Unless otherwise specified, all personal information requested through the
Services is mandatory and failure to provide this personal information may
prevent DomainsBot from providing you the Services requested.

DomainsBot does not collect or store sensitive personal
information or special categories of personal data.

**Information from Third Parties:** When you interact with our Services on a social media platform or via a third-party authentication sign-on, such as through GitHub, we may collect the personal information that you or the platform/service make available to us on that page or account, including your username, profile, or any information you have made public or otherwise available in connection with those services.

Information collection and sharing from external social networks is subject to your privacy settings for each social network.Our Services may also feature the Facebook Like button and social widgets (see the Facebook Privacy Policy here) and the Twitter Tweet button and social widgets (see the Twitter Privacy Policy here).
These platforms may collect traffic data for the pages where the widgets or buttons are installed, even when you do not click on them.

**Information Collected Automatically:** As you navigate through and interact with our Services, we may use automatic data collection technologies to collect certain information about your equipment, browsing actions and patterns (together, “User Data”), including: 
     * **Information About Your Use of the Services:** when you browse our Sites, our systems automatically collect information such as your web request, Internet Protocol (“IP”) address, browser type, browser language, domain names, referring and exit pages and URLs, platform type, pages viewed and the order of these page views, the amount of time spent on particular pages, and the date and time of your request.

* **Device Information:** if you access the Services through a mobile device (e.g., a smart phone or tablet), we may be able to identify the general location of your mobile device, your mobile device’s brand, model, operating system, resolution, screen size, system version, mobile network information, and your mobile device’s advertising ID.
* **Performance Data:** information about your preferences to make your use of the Services more productive, via the use of cookies or similar tracking technologies.

**For Customization:** saving your user account, registration and profile data or other personal information (so you do not have to re-enter it each time you visit or use the Services); tracking your return visits to and use of the services; tailoring your experience on the Services; and/or otherwise customizing what you see when you visit and use the Services; and

Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies

The Sites use cookies, which are small web files that a site or its provider
transfers to your device’s hard drive through your web browser that enables
the site’s or provider’s system to recognize your browser and remember certain
information.

DomainsBot uses first-party and third-party cookies on our Sites
to make the Sites function property, improve our overall Services, for
tailored advertising purposes, and to make your login to our Services easier
(such as by remembering your user ID).

We also use pixels, embedded tags, and other similar technologies to collect
additional personal information automatically as you interact with the
Services and to personalize your experience with our Services.

We also may use
these technologies to collect information about your online activities over
time and across third party websites or other online services, including for
our advertising purposes.

** Many advertising companies that collect information for interest-based advertising are members of the Digital Advertising Alliance (DAA) or the Network Advertising Initiative (NAI), both of which maintain websites where people can opt out of interest-based advertising from their members.
Google Analytics is a web analytics service offered by Google LLC (“Google”) that tracks and reports Site traffic.

Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on provides visitors with the ability to prevent their data from being collected and used by Google Analytics, available at: https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout.

** Our Services may utilize heat mapping services that are used to display the areas of a webpage where users most frequently move their mouse and click, in order to infer areas of interest on our Sites.
The heat mapping tool may record sessions and make them available for DomainsBot’s later visual playback.
To learn more about this practice, please read Hotjar’s Privacy Policy here, or to opt-out of the service and its collection of cookie and usage data, click here.
Opting out with that link will also opt you out of cookie and usage data collection in relation to and third-party online survey platforms, poll, and survey widgets available on our Services.

Sharing and Disclosure of Personal Information

We may share or disclose your personal information in the following
circumstances:

  1.

** We may share your personal information with any subsidiaries or affiliates, including between DomainsBot SRL and DomainsBot, Inc., in order to provide you with the Services and take actions based on your request, as well as for the purpose of management and analysis.

** We may employ other companies and individuals to facilitate our Services, provide services on our behalf, perform service-related business activities, or assist us in analyzing how our Services are used.
The service providers have access to your personal information only to perform these tasks on our behalf and are obligated not to disclose or use it for any other purpose.

** We may disclose personal information to a buyer or other successor in the event of a merger, divestiture, restructuring, reorganization, dissolution, or sale or transfer of some or all of our assets, whether as a going concern or as part of bankruptcy, liquidation, or similar proceeding, in which personal information held by us about our Services users is among the assets transferred.

** We may disclose your information if we believe that the disclosure is required by law, if we believe that the disclosure is necessary to enforce our agreements or policies, in response to valid requests by public authorities (e.g., a court or a government agency), or if we believe that the disclosure will help us protect the rights, property, or safety of DomainsBot or our customers.
** We may disclose your personal information for any purpose with your consent.
We may disclose, without restriction, aggregated or anonymized information about the users of our Services, which is information that does not identify any specific individual.
Other than what is specified in this Privacy Policy, we do not rent, sell, or trade your personal or organizational information to others.
